Name: Rosalinda Pérez Berigüete
Location: Chalona, San Juan de la Maguana
Description:
Rosalinda's body was found with stab wounds and signs of beating. Police arrested Alexis Ortiz Céspedes, 31, and José Augusto Meran Vicente, 32.

> The lifeless body of Rosalinda had several stab wounds in different parts of the body as well as blows, allegedly caused by a building block that was found right next to the bloodied victim.
>
> So far the Dominican GLBT Volunteer does not know the circumstances in which the [transgender] sex worker was killed. The body will be sent to the National Institute of Forensic Sciences in Santo Domingo for autopsy.

Name: Pebbles LaDime Doe
Description:
Pebbles was found dead in a driveway on Sunday 4th August. Despite identifying as female on Facebook, news outlets and her family consistently misgendered her.

> Pebbles LaDime ‘Dime” Doe was 24 years old. She was born in 1994 and raised in Allendale, South Carolina. On August 4, she was murdered in her hometown less than 100 miles from the place where Denali Stuckey, another Black trans woman, was killed in late July.
>
> Details are sketchy right now and the limited media is misgendering and deadnaming Pebbles. She made her identity quite clear on her Facebook page where posts also implied she had strong relationships with people in her family of origin. Family members say Dime’s body was found inside of a car in a driveway off of Concord Church Road in Allendale County.
>
> Doe was found Sunday by a passerby, slumped over the steering wheel of her car in the area of Concord Church and Barnwell roads in Allendale County, according to the State Law Enforcement Division. She had been shot.

Her Facebook profile is https://www.facebook.com/DimeDivaa22/.

https://www.wjbf.com/news/transgender-woman-killed-in-allendale-county-sc-second-in-recent-weeks-in-sc/

https://web.archive.org/web/20210417224021/https://planettransgender.com/pebbles-ladime-doe-murdered-in-south-carolina/

https://www.pghlesbian.com/2019/08/pebbles-ladime-doe-is-the-14th-trans-woman-murdered-in-the-us-during-2019/

https://transgriot.blogspot.com/2019/08/number-14-rest-in-power-pebbles-ladime.html

Pebbles LaDime Doe was as found dead in a driveway in Allendale County, South Carolina (USA) on 4 Aug 2019. News outlets and her family consistently misgendered her.

She was 24. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Jordan Cofer
Description:
Jordan was one of the victims of the Ohio mass shooting on Sunday 4th August. The perpetrator - his brother - was shot dead at the scene by police.

> A victim of the Ohio mass shooting and sibling of the shooter, Jordan Cofer, has been revealed to be a transgender man by friends who say he has been deadnamed by the media.
>
> The 22-year-old was among nine people killed in the attack in Dayton, Ohio on Sunday (August 4), but has been widely misgendered and deadnamed by police and the media. He has been labelled as the “sister” of Connor Bretts, the perpetrator of the tragedy.
>
> A close friend of Cofer’s told Splinter over Twitter DM that he actually identified as a transgender man.
>
> “Jordan was my closest friend,” the anonymous friend said. “He identified with he/him pronouns to people he trusted and knew would support him. Jordan was probably one of the sweetest people you would ever meet, a true saint, but he was also very scared constantly. He tried to give the best to everyone.”
>
> According to his friend, Cofer was not out to his family, including his brother.
>
> Cofer was one of the first of his brother’s victims. It is unclear to police if Betts intended to kill him or if Cofer was attempting to stop his brother from killing more people.

Jordan's Twitter and Tumblr accounts are https://www.twitter.com/jordandaroomie and https://www.tumblr.com/dashboard/blog/supernaturalpentaholic respectively.

Name: Gabriele Oliveira ("Princess")
Description:
Gabriele's body was found along with that of Robson Carlos da Silva in a closed bar on Monday 5th August. Both had been shot.

> The [trans woman] [deadname] de Oliveira Dias, better known as Gabriele Oliveira, 21 years old, was found dead last Monday, August 5, in the city of Belo Jardim, located in the wild of the State of Pernambuco-PE.
>
> [Gabriele], who was also nicknamed "Princess", was found in a closed bar in the city of Belo Jardim, located at Cicinato Pires Raposo Street in the Santo Antonio neighborhood in the company of a man identified as Robson Carlos da Silva, also found lifeless.
> 
> According to information given by the police, the establishment had been broken into at around 11 pm and the two were executed with several gunshots. One victim was found on a bed while the other  was found in the hallway of the establishment.

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was found dead on the morning of Tuesday 6th August. She had been shot in the face.

> Tecomán.- The lifeless body of a [person], killed with a firearm, was found on the morning of this Tuesday, August 6, in the vicinity of Las Palmas de Tecomán neighborhood, police sources confirmed.
>
> The facts were reported by witnesses to the emergency numbers shortly before 06:00 hours, mentioning the finding at the height of Amela Canal Street so elements of different security corporations came. The latter confirmed the above and proceeded to carry out the corresponding investigations.
>
> It transpired that the deceased was transgender, approximately 30 years old and had been shot in the face. Their identity has not yet been confirmed.

Name: J. A. Cermeño Medina
Description:
J.'s body was found on the street and was subsequently identified by relatives. She had been shot 3 times.

> Around 10:30 pm last Wednesday, the body of a [trans woman] was found in the center of Avenida Bolívar de Maracay, a few meters from the Pérez Almarza Boulevard. The body had wounds caused by three shots, one of them near her neck.
>
> She wore a black dress, black lycra and black booties. Her physical features are dark complexion, thin build, long hair, false eyelashes and a tattoo at hip height. She had had several surgical interventions.
>
> The motive for the murder is unknown, in addition to who the material perpetrators are. It is expected that in the next few days the individual will be identified by relatives.

The victim was subsequently identified as [deadname] Cermeño Medina, 31, a native of Caracas.

Name: Angi García ("La Gata")
Description:
Angi's body was found in her home by family members on Wednesday 7th August. She had been strangled.

> A trans woman known as La Gata died in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, bringing to eight the number of deaths (for murder or violent death) of trans people in Ecuador since the beginning of the year. A worrying fact, if we consider that, last year, there was only one case of murder in the country.
>
> The death of La Gata came just two days after the discovery of the corpse of Karla Fernanda Silva, poisoned in the province of Cotopaxi after taking diet pills. The drugs are suspected to have contained Racumin rat poison.

Name: Cris García Aponte
Description:
Cris was found dead at home after reportedly ingesting poison. Blood was found on her face and her death is considered suspicious.

> On Monday the Ecuadorian Federation of LGBTI Organizations denounced "the violent death" and asked for investigation of the death of a transsexual woman in the province of El Oro, in the south of the country, shortly after the possible murders of two other trans [women] in Ecuador became known.
>
> In a statement signed by several leaders of the collective, the discovery of the lifeless body of the woman, identified as Cris García and 34, was reported last Saturday [10th August] at her home in the Los Ceibos sector of the Huaquillas canton, in the aforementioned border province with Peru.
>
> Diane Rodríguez, the Director of the local Association Silhouette X and President of the Ecuadorian Federation of LGBTI Organizations - which brings together about forty associations - released several photographs in which the victim is allegedly seen lying on a bed face up and with apparent traces of blood on her face.
>
> "The victim was found by her sister and apparently death occurred a day before, since the body was found in a state of decomposition," the letter said.
>
> The relative suggested that her sister had ingested poison, arguing that she had told friends before that she was going to make the "fatal decision," the text said in reference to the fact that she had expressed a desire to end her life.
>
> The sister of the deceased clarified that Cris faced depression, the product of a possible emotional breakdown, which may have led her to commit suicide.
>
> However, Darwin Romero and Cesar Condoy, members of the LGBT Association of Huaquillas and the Federation at the national level said that no evidence of possible poisoning was found at the scene and that the body was found lying in bed, naked and in dorsal recumbency [lying on her back].
>
> These last and strange circumstances have led the leaders of the Ecuadorian LGTB collective to suspect that it could have been a new case of violent death of a trans [woman].
>
> "We ask authorities such as the National Police, Prosecutor's Office and the Judicial Council to investigate the case, so that they can find the guilty party(s) of this execrable fact and bring justice with all the rigor of the law," says the statement.

Chris was an active member of the LGTBI community of the Huaquillas canton and worked as a stylist.

Name: Keyiariah Quick
Description:
Keyiariah was found dead on 10th August. Although she was initially widely reported to have been murdered, her family subsequently requested that her death not be reported as such.

> UPDATE: We’ve just been informed that the family of Keyiariah Quick, the Black trans woman we were told was found deceased on August 10th in NC, has asked that folks stop suggesting that she was killed.
>
> They do not wish to publicly disclose what has happened to her, but we are asking that folk please respect their wishes.
>
> We apologize for any negative impact this reporting has caused, and we also understand that the death of any Black trans woman, regardless of cause, is a sad and painful event. Our heart goes out to her friends and family and community who loved her.

Name: Aylin Hernández Gómez
Description:
Aylin's body was found covered by a motel bedsheet and dumped in undergrowth. Her body had signs of sexual violence and she had been strangled.

> San Cristóbal de Las Casas.- A lifeless body was found covered by a sheet in undergrowth.
>
> The emergency services arrived at around 7:30 a.m. on Sunday to the eastern Peripheral, next to the place known as "La Canasta", where they were first informed of a woman lying on the undergrowth.
>
> Municipal police elements cordoned off the area upon arrival; Municipal Civil Protection paramedics also arrived, who when examining the body, which was wrapped in a blanket, confirmed that unfortunately she had no vital signs.

> [deadname] Hernández Gómez, 34, known in the Travesti world as Aylin, was the person found dead on the side of the road that leads to the area known as the basket in San Cristóbal de Las Casas.
>
> Aylin was originally from the northern part of Chiapas and was a sex worker operating in the municipality of San Cristóbal de Las Casas.

https://alertachiapas.com/2020/08/21/un-pueblo-transfeminicida-no-es-magico/

Aylin Hernández Gómez's body was found covered by a motel bedsheet and dumped in undergrowth in San Cristóbal de Las Casas, Chiapas (Mexico) on 11 Aug 2019.

Name: Cameron Haswell
Description:
Cameron's body was found the day after they went missing on their way home from a skate park. At the time they died they were wearing female clothing.

> The aunt of a teenager who was found hanged wearing a women's jumpsuit has spoken out about the 18-year-old's hidden gender identity struggle in a bid to raise awareness.
>
> Cameron Haswell was found dead in Blackwater on the morning of August 11 after going missing on [their] way home from Sandhurst skate park at around 5.30pm the day before.
>
> An inquest into Cameron's death took place in Basingstoke on November 19, with [their] aunt Nicola Haswell saying that a verdict of suicide was returned.
>
> Speaking in the days after the hearing, Nicola, the sister of Cameron's mum, told SurreyLive that the family had not been aware of how [Cameron] had been found until six weeks after [their] death.
>
> In an emotional comment, she said: "After suffering the initial shock of losing Cameron in the way that we did, and having had [their] funeral, we were attempting to try and pick ourselves up and carry on as best as we could when we were informed by the police that when Cameron was found, [they] was wearing a women's jumpsuit.
>
> "During the inquest, we learned that [Cameron] also had a bag of female clothes in [their] possession. This completely threw everybody, but only because, as a family, we had no idea that this was something that we may have to consider."
>
> Since Cameron's death, dozens have come together to pay tribute to the "caring, beautiful and funny" teenager, with around 80 of those close to him wearing specially designed yellow t-shirts for [their] funeral on September 11.

*Editor's Note: Although we will probably never know what Cameron's gender identity was or whether they had another name they would have preferred us to know them by, gender neutral pronouns are used in this report out of respect for their identity, whatever it actually was.*

Cameron's Facebook profile is https://www.facebook.com/cameron.haswell.378.

Name: W. Félix de Oliveira
Description:
W. was beaten to death inside a residence in the Pajuçara neighborhood. Two men were arrested.

> Two men were arrested on the morning of Thursday (19), suspected of killing [trans woman] [deadname] de Oliveira, 29, with stones and beatings on Sunday (11) [August] in the Pajuçara neighborhood, Maracanaú, Greater Fortaleza. The crime was motivated by the theft of a mobile device in a place dominated by the criminal faction of which the suspects were involved. The men were arrested in the Pajuçara neighborhood.
>
> According to police chief Daniel Coelho of the Maracanaú Metropolitan Police Department of Homicide, the suspects, identified as Antônio Joélio, 22, and Douglas Bento Azevedo, 21, were implicated for being part of a criminal organization and for qualified homicide.

Name: Sara Miranda de Souza ("Tayla")
Description:
Tayla was stabbed in the neck after an argument. Police arrested Vitor Henrique, 22, near the scene of the murder.

> A [trans woman] was killed with two stab wounds to her neck in Frutal on Monday, 12, at Raul José Miziara Street, Vila Esperança neighborhood.
>
> According to police, the main suspect in the crime is a man who was seen in the company of the victim moments before the murder. Vitor Henrique, 22, known as Vitinho, was arrested in the act by the PM shortly after the crime, hiding in his maternal grandmother's house near the scene.
>
> He had bloodstains on his legs and feet and carried a four-inch knife. When questioned he confessed to causing the injuries that caused the death of the victim.
>
> Two witnesses said they saw the victim and suspect fighting. Before stabbing the victim, Vitor punched and kicked her when she was already lying on the ground.  Previously they had gone to a 24-hour shop together for a drink but after returning they argued.
>
> Information from witnesses is that the victim used the social names Tayla and Sara Miranda. She was identified by birth name as [deadname] de Souza, 41 years old.

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was stabbed following an argument. Her killer was arrested.

> A 41-year-old [trans woman] was killed with two stab wounds to her neck at dawn on Monday (12) in Frutal, in Triangle Mineiro. According to two witnesses, the murder came after a fight between the victim and the perpetrator who, before stabbing her, punched and then kicked her while she was already lying on the ground.
>
> The suspect and victim had earlier gone to a 24-hour establishment to buy cachaça [a distilled spirit made from fermented sugarcane juice]. The [trans woman] and suspect both left, but returned, arguing, ten minutes later.
>
> The 22-year-old suspect had previously committed other crimes. He was found by the Military Police shortly after the murder, hiding in his maternal grandmother's house. He had bloodstains on his legs and feet and carried a four-inch knife that could be the murder weapon.

https://www.hojeemdia.com.br/horizontes/travesti-%C3%A9-morta-com-facadas-no-pesco%C3%A7o-em-frutal-no-tri%C3%A2ngulo-mineiro-1.734867

https://triangulonoticias.com/vitima-e-morta-e-suspeito-e-preso-com-marcas-de-sangue-no-corpo/
Tweet:
An unidentified #trans woman was stabbed in Frutal, Minas Gerais (Brazil) on 12 Aug 2019. Her killer was arrested.

She was 41. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Abril Navarro Salazar
Description:
Abril died from multiple stab wounds after being attacked in the street.

> Mexico City.- A transsexual woman known as April was stabbed in different parts of the body on August 13 in the La Cañada neighborhood, Álvaro Obregón district.
>
> Witnesses report that April was addicted to cocaine. On Tuesday night, April and a woman nicknamed "La Güera", went together went to buy drugs.
>
> At a location between Paso del Molino and Luis G. Urbina, a man approached them and attacked April with a knife directly in front of La Güera who did not attempt to intervene. "La Güera" and the aggressor escaped.
>
> When the police arrived they requested the support of paramedics, who upon arrival diagnosed the death of the young woman, who had sufferred eight stab wounds.
>
> The victim's relatives identified her as [deadname] Navarro Salazar, 26, and said that she worked in a restaurant.
>
> According to her sister, Julieta, 20, “La Güera” had threatened April because she knew about the death of a man known as “El Quemado”, killed a week ago in front of Salvador Nava Elementary, in the colony Jalalpa Tepito.

https://www.diariodemexico.com/matan-pu%C3%B1aladas-una-mujer-trans-en-%C3%A1lvaro-obreg%C3%B3n

https://www.elgrafico.mx/la-roja/matan-transexual-de-ocho-punaladas-cuando-se-disponia-comprar-droga-en-alvaro-obregon
Tweet:
Abril Navarro Salazar was stabbed in the La Cañada neighborhood of Ciudad de Mexico, Estado de México (Mexico) on 13 Aug 2019.

She was 26. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Nathacha Ruby Flores ("Samantha")
Description:
Nathacha was stabbed outside her home. She was a hairdresser. Note that reports variously name her as Natasha Ruby Arévalo Carvajal, Nathacha Ruby Flores (the name on her Facebook profile), Ruby or Samantha. > Until 19:00 on Friday, August 16, 2019, Natacha Ruby Arévalo Carvajal (who was better known as 'Samantha' or 'Ruby') was at work in Manabí Street in the Historic Center of Quito. According to witnesses, at one point she disappeared and less than three hours later she was found dead. > > Her cousin Jessica Tipán, says that the 25-year-old died of a stab in the heart. The death certificate, issued by the Civil Registry, establishes the cause of his death as a "thoracic trauma due to a sharp puncture-internal acute hemorrhage." > > According to Tipán, her cousin was found lifeless at about 9:30 p.m. on Friday, August 16, 2019, in the stands of the building where she lived, on Napo Avenue, in the south of Quito. But she was not stabbed there - surveillance cameras shows that she was attacked by a couple at the entrance of the property. > > 'Samantha' was a hairdresser known in the La Marín sector, says Tipán, who remembers her cousin as a person "very cheerful and calm. She didn't mess with others. She was very good." After the body was found, relatives realized that the girl was not carrying her phone. > > One person - Eduardo D. - has been detained, but the relatives of 'Samantha' ask the authorities to investigate the crime that Tipán describes as "confusing." > > "The complaint was filed, there is a detainee, but we want the events to be investigated well." Therefore, they will attend this Tuesday, August 20, 2019 at 10:00 at the Pichincha Provincial Prosecutor's Office. > > The death of 'Samantha', a trans woman, was also reported on Monday, August 19, 2019 by the Ecuadorian Federation of LGBTI Organizations. "There have been countless times, in which from this institution, we have asked the authorities such as the National Police, Prosecutor's Office and the Judiciary Council, to carry out the necessary investigations of this type of violent deaths suspected of criminality and murders, without having an answer", the Lgbti federation warned. Nathacha's Facebook profile is https://www.facebook.com/samantha.arevalo.100.

Natacha Ruby Flores #MujerTrans, de #Quito, asesinada en su lugar de trabajo, #alerta #Femicidio @FiscaliaEcuador @PoliciaEcuador @MinGobiernoEc @DDHH_Ec @DerechosQuito pic.twitter.com/XRCCN2bUDY

— Asociación ALFIL (@AsociacionALFIL) August 19, 2019
https://www.elcomercio.com/actualidad/familiares-investigacion-muerte-trans-quito.html https://www.tn8.tv/america-latina/482699-ecuador-grupo-lgbti-denuncia-nuevo-asesinato-mujer-trans-muertes-/ http://aguasdigital.com/alerta/leer.php?idnota=15679650&t=e https://twitter.com/CasaDeMunecasEC/status/1163503222801215490 https://twitter.com/AsociacionALFIL/status/1163483917623726082

Nathacha Ruby Flores was stabbed outside her home in Quito (Ecuador) on 17 Aug 2019.

She was 25, and a hairdresser. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Aline da Silva
Description:
Aline was stabbed in the neck by a stranger at a bus stop. She was homeless and an activist for the Landless Rural Workers Movement of the state of Pernambuco.

> The Landless Rural Workers Movement of the state of Pernambuco deplores the murder of militant Aline da Silva, a landless [i.e. homeless] [trans woman] who lived in the Malhada camp in the municipality of Arcoverde (PE). Aline was part of the Youth Collective and was a young woman active in the activities of the Movement. One of the last activities she participated in was the Resistance Caravan for the Semi-arid Lula Livre.
>
> She was murdered at dawn on Aug. 19 with a stab wound to her neck as she was leaving a party when a man who did not know her saw her at the bus stop and decided to hurt her. As fascism has been growing as a political and ideological bloc, led by leader Jair Bolsonaro, who normalises the deaths of women and LGBT, hatred, violence and injustice have advanced. Because of this, violence against women and LGBT [people] increases daily.

http://desacato.info/militante-aline-da-silva-travesti-sem-terra-e-assassinada/

http://www.mst.org.br/2019/08/20/contra-a-transfobia-e-por-aline-resistiremos.html

https://blogdosilvalima.com.br/travesti-de-22-anos-e-assassinada-a-golpe-de-faca-em-arcoverde/

https://pernambuconoticias.com.br/hoje-travesti-assassinada-a-facadas-em-arcoverde-suspeito-foi-identificado/
Tweet:
Aline da Silva was stabbed in the neck by a stranger at a bus stop in Arcoverde, Pernambuco (Brazil) on 19 Aug 2019.

She was 22. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim's body was found by police dumped in a stream with her hands tied. She had been suffocated.

> Ciudad Juarez.- A [trans woman], with dyed hair and wearing women's clothing, was killed early this mornin and her body located in a stream in the Libertad neighborhood. 
>
> The Attorney General's Office (FGE) in the North Zone, through its spokesman Alejandro Ruvalcaba, announced that the victim was not a [cisgender] woman as initially thought by the Ministry of Public Security (SSPM), whose agents were First responders at the scene.
>
> When moving the body to the facilities of the Forensic Medical Service (Semefo) the doctors realized that she was a [trans woman] of approximately 25 years.
>
> Apparently she was suffocated and had her hands tied at the time of the discovery, Ruvalcaba said.

https://diario.mx/juarez/era-de-hombre-cadaver-hallado-en-arroyo-estaba-vestido-de-mujer-20190819-1552453.html
Tweet:
The body of an unidentified #trans woman was found by police dumped in a stream in Ciudad Juarez, Chihuahua (Mexico) on 19 Aug 2019. Her hands were tied and she had been suffocated.

She was 25. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Ashley
Description:
Ashley's body was found on the street near a church on the morning of Wednesday 21th August. She had been stabbed.

> Huajuapan de León, Oax.- The lifeless body of a person from the LGBTTTIQ community who responded to the name of [deadname] known as “La Muda” or Ashley and killed by stabbing was found in a private area on calle Nuyoo in the colonia El Calvario, next to the church in the area where the Indio de Nuyoo monument is also located.
>
> The events were at approximately 9:30 am on Wednesday when emergency services were alerted to the discovery of a body next to a truck that was parked in the aforementioned area.

Ashley would have turned 39 on 23rd August. In the local community she was nicknamed "La Muda" as she was reportedly unable to speak. She was originally from the municipality of Villa de Tezoatlán de Segura and Luna, but lived in the Santa Rosa neighborhood of Huajuapan de León.

Name: Kate Maikelly de Jesus Barbosa
Description:
Kate's body was found in undergrowth near a waste disposal unit. The body had a cut to the right hand and bruising to the face but showed no evidence of the cause of death.

> An unidentified [trans woman] was found dead on the afternoon of Wednesday, August 21, amid the undergrowth of a wasteland on Rua Governador José Marcelino de Souza, near the CSU (Centro Social Urbano) in the Monte Castelo neighborhood of Teixeira of Freitas. 
>
> A team of experts from the Department of Technical Police (DPT) performed body and on-site expertise and found no injuries that may have resulted in the death of the [trans woman]. According to Flávio Sampaio, DPT director, in the body were found two minor injuries that did not cause death. 
>
> The area is used by drug users and people who go to the place for clandestine encounters. The [trans woman] was wearing a striped shirt, yellow shorts, red bra and sneakers. Beside the body was a black bag containing no identification documents.

Name: Daniela Martinez
Description:
Daniela was found tied and with her feet burned having been beaten. She died in hospital.

She had been attacked twice before.

> Repudiation and indignation, has generated the recent homicide of a 53-year-old trans woman identified as Daniela Martínez, in events that occurred in the rural area of ​​the municipality of Cicuco, south of the department of Bolívar.
>
> According to Wilson Castañeda, director of the Caribbean Affirmative Corporation, the victim was approached in a public street by three subjects, who allegedly had already assaulted her on two other occasions.
>
> Then, with sticks, stones and other blunt objects, they proceeded to attack her and leave her severely injured in her head and face. The woman died due to the seriousness of the injuries in a health center in the area.

https://caracol.com.co/emisora/2019/08/22/cartagena/1566429001_917809.html

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was shot 3 times by two men on a scooter while leaving the bar where she worked in the early hours of the morning. She died at the scene.

> Acapulco Gro; August 23, 2019.- A female bar worker was shot dead outside the Papagayo Medical Tower, located in the Hornos de Acapulco subdivision.
>
> This fact was recorded around 05:30 hours on Friday on Antonio Pigaffeta Street of the aforementioned subdivision, between Miguel Aleman Costera Avenue and Cuauhtémoc, next to Papagayo Park.
>
> The place was attended by municipal, state and military police, who cordoned off the perimeter and subsequently staff of the Regional Prosecutor to take charge of the proceedings.
>
> The woman allegedly left a bar located in the area to go shopping at a taqueria, when two gunmen aboard a scooter attacked and killed her.
>
> The body lay on the sidewalk about 5 meters from the back door of the hospital.
>
> Investigators located in the place a total of 14 shell casings and three 9-millimeter bullets.
>
> The victim was a woman between 30 and 35 years old, with a regular complexion and dark complexion, who wore a black fitted dress.

Name: Hani
Description:
Hani was shot 5 times when gunman broke into the house she was renting.

> MANSEHRA: A transgender person was killed when gunmen barged into his house and opened fire in Mansehra city of Khyber Paktunkhwa, police said on Tuesday.
>
>The police said [deadname] alias Hani, a resident of Abbottabad, was staying at a rented house in Nari Muhalla of Mansehra city.
>
> The police arrived on the crime scene after being informed about the incident by [her] neighbors.
>
> The investigators collected bullet casings and other evidence from the scene after shifting the body to the District Hospital Mansehra for medico-legal formalities.
>
> The police said [the] motive behind the murder was yet to be known.

Roberta was shot.

>
> Better known as Roberta Xirrara, the victim was 44 years old and lived outside Brazil for many years.

Name: Sana Khan
Description:
Sana was killed by her brother. She was a Pashto musician and her murder follows that of several others in the province.

> SWAT: Yet another Pashto artist was killed allegedly by her brother in Swat on Friday. TNN correspondent has reported that the singer, Sana, was stabbed to death in Banr area, a famous center for Pashto musicians in Swat district.
>
> Police said that so far the motive behind the brutal murder couldn’t be ascertained as they are still conducting the investigation into the case. Police added that the accused is the real brother of the victim, who escaped after committing the crime.
>
> The dead body of the artist, Sana, was shifted to Saidu Sharif Hospital for post mortem.
>
> The Khyber Pakhtunkhwa has never been a safe place for Pashto artists as a number of women singers have been killed by their relatives. On May 7, 2019, local singer Meena was killed in Swat. According to police, Meena, was killed by her husband in Banr area of Swat.
>
> In recent years, Pashto music has lost famous singer Ghazala Javed at the hands of her husband. Ayman Udas, another artiste, was allegedly killed by her brothers over claims of dishonouring the family. Singer Rabia Tabasum was poisoned. The 18-year-old Pashto singer Karishma Shahzadi was allegedly killed after being injected with a spurious injection in Charsadda.
>
> Another 18-year-old actor Bushra suffered burns on her face when acid was flung on her in Nowshera. In February this year, stage actor Sumbal had been shot in the Shaikh Maltoon area of Mardan. In June, Pashto artiste Gulnaz, alias Muskan, was shot in Peshawar’s Bhana Mari area. In August 2018, another Pashto singer Risham Khan was brutally murdered by her husband in Nowshera district.

https://planettransgender.com/another-transgender-pashto-performer-murdered-in-swat/

https://zeenews.india.com/another-pashto-singer-killed-in-pakistans-swat-police-say-accused-brother-absconding-2231117.html

https://www.tnn.com.pk/brother-kills-pashto-singer-in-swat-says-the-police/

https://www.wionews.com/south-asia/pakistani-pashto-singer-murdered-by-her-brother-in-apparent-honour-killing-246808

https://www.facebook.com/TransActionPak/posts/2693421997336066

https://www.facebook.com/TransActionPak/posts/2693482787329987

Sana Khan was stabbed by her brother in Banr, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (Pakistan) on 30 Aug 2019.

She was a Pashto musician and her murder follows that of several others in the province. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was shot in the head at the entrance to a bar and died in hospital. She had previously spoken out against homophobic statements made by the authorities.

> A [trans woman] who had demonstrated days ago against alleged homophobic statements made by the authorities of the municipality of Zihuatanejo in Mexico was killed at gunpoint in the region of Costa Grande de Guerrero. 
>
> As reported by the New York Daily, the events occurred outside a bar called "La Manguito" where they found the victim with a gunshot to the head. 
>
> “Police and effective agents of the National Guard came to the scene of the aggression, who located the body of the [woman] who belonged to the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, transgender and intersexual (LGBTTI) community, and was helped by paramedics from the Red Cross and transferred to a hospital.
>
> According to some local media, the victim had protested against local authorities alleged racist and classist statements, especially against members of the gay community in the area.
>
> The authorities do not rule out the possibility that armed groups might be responsible for the attack. The homicide rate in the area is multiplied because according to Mexican authorities, three drug cartels and five criminal cells (Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG), Guerreros Unidos,  Los Rojos, Los Ardillos and Acapulco Independent Cartel (CIDA)) have a presence in the state of Guerrero.

Name: Brigitte Escalona Escobar
Description:
Brigitte was a hairdresser. She was found dying in the street after a robbery after leaving for work.

> A 21-year-old hairdresser was killed by suffocation and multiple strokes, according to her relatives' version.
> 
> The deceased is [deaname] Escalona Escobar (21), a [trans woman] known as Brigitte. She had been missing since Friday, August 31. Caracas firefighters found her dying on a sidewalk on Leoncio Martínez avenue, specifically behind the Inces of Nueva Granada, Libertador municipality. Her body showed signs of having been suffocated and had sustained multiple blows. The attacker stripped her of her clothes, purse, a chain, cell phone and some sandals she had bought.
>
> She was admitted without vital signs in the Domingo Luciani hospital. Meanwhile, her relatives were looking for her in health centers and police establishments. Last Wednesday they went to Domingo Luciani where they were informed that [deadname]'s body was in the morgue of that hospital.

Name: Giselle Andrea Gutiérrez Valencia
Description:
Giselle died from propane gas poisoning in her bathroom. Her body was found lying on a mat by her ex-partner.

> The body of Giselle Andrea Gutiérrez Valencia, 26, was lying on a mat and inside the bathroom of the Carrera 109 A-63A -35 apartment in the Villas Del Dorado neighborhood in Engativá and a few meters from a gas stove.
>
> The young woman who belonged to the Lgbti Differential Focus group probably entered into an emotional crisis and decided to take her life silently.
>
> EXTRA managed to learn that Gutiérrez Valencia, who was a professional stylist in the Engativá area, was found by her former sentimental partner who took her to the Hospital.
>
> The circumstances of her death are being examined by the authorities to know the true cause of what happened.
>
> From the moment she arrived in the neighborhood the young woman earned the love and respect of the residents and coworkers of the beauty salon where she worked after completing several hairdressing courses in one of the well-known academies of the city. Her work was very professional, and her services were in great demand.
>
> During this period she met his partner with whom she managed to establish a beautiful relationship, which lasted until the day of her death. The cupid-headed ones leased an apartment on a third floor where respect and love reigned.
>
> On Saturday, August 31, the evidence seems to indicate that hours before her death Giselle was doing several chores concerning her profession and once she finished, she went into her home and probably led by depression, decided to end her life. The theory suggests that she took the gas stove to the bathroom, laid a mat, opened the valve and let the propane gas out.

Giselle's Facebook profile is https://www.facebook.com/giselleandrea.gutierrezvalencia.7.
